sense.name: refer to as, give a designation, distinguish
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] LABEL NP2[theme] NP3[attribute] NP1[agent] LABEL NP2[theme] PP{P NP[attribute]} NP1[attribute] LABEL NP2[theme] as NP3[attribute]
sense.examples: However, I would be very, VERY wary about who was labeling a blind child M.R. The FBI labeled him as a subversive. His most recent jobs have clearly labeled him as one of the few men trusted with power. The direction of the deflecting electric field E and its gradient will be labeled the z-axis.

sense.name: physically put a tag/marker/label on something
sense.examples: Please label those bottles. I carefully labeled the major regions of wine and cheese production. The main molecular features were clearly labeled. My next temp job was labeling and moving office furniture.
